definition: to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan

sentences.english: He is wise that hath wit enough for hellos own affairs.
sentences.chinese: 懂事情的道理者有足够的机智措置惩罚本身的工作。

sentences.english: Describe a time when a problem wast resolved to your satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 描写你对于疑难题目的措置惩罚不称心的一次履历。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang really didn't know what to do with fabulous fortune at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 王师少西席一时没有知如何措置那笔巨额财产。

sentences.english: Come on , Julia, you know you can handle it.
sentences.chinese: 快点，朱莉娅，你知道你能措置这事的。

sentences.english: Good manners also dictate that you handle your mail promptly and courteously.
sentences.chinese: 得体的行为举止也表此刻你能实时有礼貌地措置信件。

sentences.english: An accumulation of data to be processed.
sentences.chinese: 要措置的数据的一种聚积。

sentences.english: Submersible pump fish tank a very wide range of water - use tools.
sentences.chinese: 一种用场很是广泛的水措置惩罚东西。

sentences.english: Tell me about the most difficult problem you've ever dealt with.
sentences.chinese: 谈谈你措置惩罚过的最难的疑难题目。

sentences.english: I was asked to come to your company on my way home in order to settle the claim.
sentences.chinese: 我顺道来你们公司是为了措置赏罚赏罚索赔题目的。

definition: variant of 籌劃|筹划[chou2 hua4]
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
to pass by without showing interest (idiom)
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
variant of 靡費|靡费[mi2 fei4]
to lay out (an argument) item by item/memorandum to a superior
variant of 參與|参与[can1 yu4]
to restore (deposed monarch, rule, system of laws, ecological system etc)/restoration
